definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: Maybe the bitter threaten our attitude towards peoples and doing things.
sentences.chinese: 沉痛可能威脅到以後我們待人處事的態度。

sentences.english: His gaze was full of pity, anguish, and supplication.
sentences.chinese: 他的目光充滿着憐憫沉痛的神情，他正在一心祈禱。

sentences.english: I shook my head from side to side, pitifully.
A Canadian woman reportedly learned her lesson the hard way.
sentences.chinese: 據報道一個加拿大婦女沉痛的吸收了教訓。

sentences.english: I could see his pained expression as he said this.
sentences.chinese: 他說這番話時，可以看見他表情沉痛。

sentences.english: But this form of capitalism has been sorely tested by the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 但這一形式的資本主義已受到危機沉痛的檢驗。
時間能溫和極度的沉痛。

sentences.english: Listen to the wind, flowers, remorse, and also wise pupils in quiet beautiful manner.
sentences.chinese: 以靜美的形態傾聽風，花朵，沉痛，還有智慧的雙眼。

sentences.english: We should not forget the bitter lesson.
sentences.chinese: 我們切不可忘記這沉痛教訓。

sentences.english: This was the sad lesson of the dotcom bubble.
sentences.chinese: 這是網絡泡沫帶來的沉痛教訓。

definition: to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past
bitter and hateful (idiom)/to grieve and lament (over sth)
